abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention study published in The New England Journal of Medicine finds deadly bacterial infection Clostridium difficile is estimated to have afflicted almost half a million Americans and caused 29,000 deaths in 2011.
lead_paragraph: Clostridium difficile is estimated to have afflicted almost half a million Americans and caused 29,000 deaths in 2011, according to a new study.

headline.main: Death Toll From C. Difficile Is Raised
headline.print_headline: Death Toll From Bacteria Is Raised

snippet: Clostridium difficile is estimated to have afflicted almost half a million Americans and caused 29,000 deaths in 2011, according to a new study.
